channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: When Jamie Dimon poached a top Berkshire exec, he called Warren Buffett, who said ‘If he’s going anywhere, at least he’s going to you’
item.description: Former Geico CEO Todd Combs had been at Berkshire since 2010.

item.title: A $12.6 Billion Budget Gap May Complicate Mamdani’s Affordability Plans
item.description: The New York City comptroller, Mark Levine, said that poor budgeting practices by the previous mayor, Eric Adams, had left the city with looming defic...

item.title: Betting stocks fall as NFL prediction bets gain on gambling apps
item.description: Platforms like Kalshi and Polymarket reported surging activity last week during the beginning of the NFL playoff season.

item.title: Dominion Energy wins bid to resume wind project Trump halted
item.description: The ruling marks the third time this week that an offshore wind project was allowed to resume despite a government stop-work order.

item.title: Powell, an Unlikely Foil, Takes On Trump
item.description: Jerome H. Powell, the chair of the Federal Reserve, this week tapped a groundswell of support that has been years in the making.

item.title: Bill Gates isn’t even close to America’s largest private landowner. It’s ‘Silent Stan’ Kroenke, Walmart husband and LA Rams owner
item.description: Kroenke’s purchase of nearly 1 million acres of ranchland marks a growing trend of the ultrawealthy snapping up farmland as an alternative asset.

item.title: Virginia Moves Closer to New House Maps That Could Set Democrats Up for a Win
item.description: Voters will now get a say over whether the current maps can be redrawn ahead of the 2026 midterm elections.

item.title: Trump Sets Fraudster Free From Prison for a Second Time
item.description: The president issued a raft of clemency grants this week, including pardoning a woman he had given relief to once before and a man whose daughter had ...

item.title: U.S. Lawmakers Meet With Danish Prime Minister on Greenland
item.description: Seeking to calm tensions, Republicans and Democrats affirmed that they supported Denmark’s control of Greenland as President Trump vowed to buy it or ...

item.title: How a series of calculated risks led a BNY executive to the C-suite of America’s oldest bank
item.description: In a CEO search, small moments can end a candidacy instantly.

item.title: Russian Strikes Force Kyiv Schools to Close Amid Rolling Blackouts
item.description: Russia has targeted Ukraine’s energy infrastructure in past winters, but this year intensified its attacks as temperatures in Ukraine plunged well bel...

item.title: Canada Strikes Tariffs Deal With China, as Carney Looks to Diversify From U.S.
item.description: China will in turn cut its own tariffs on Canadian canola products, Prime Minister Mark Carney of Canada said in Beijing on Friday.

item.title: Iran Protests Quelled Since Deadly Crackdown, Residents Say
item.description: “There is massive disappointment and disillusionment,” one Tehran resident said. A human rights group acknowledged that demonstrations had been subdue...

item.title: After Trump Call, Colombia’s Petro Turns Up Heat on Far-Left Armed Group
item.description: President Gustavo Petro of Colombia is taking a harder line against the National Liberation Army, or ELN, a leftist group experts call a powerful drug...

item.title: Ex-South Korean Leader Gets Prison Term in First Ruling Over Martial Law
item.description: A court handed down five years in prison to former President Yoon Suk Yeol, who is facing multiple trials stemming from his short-lived imposition of ...
